PGA Golf Club Member Benefits include: No Assessments, or Food & Beverage Minimums Play all of our golf courses – Wanamaker, Ryder, and Dye Course for $27 per round all year, with reduced fees for guests Annual Memberships available Complimentary Practice Facility with TopTracer Technology Private Golf Car Program allows you to use your own golf car on all courses Tee times up to 7 days in advance Member social and golf events at PGA Golf Club Private Dining Wine Club Instruction, Merchandise and Food & Beverage Discounts To inquire about Club Membership opportunities, contact Sales Manager Richard Harrell at [email protected] or call (772) 467-5487 Form Designer DummyValue First Name * Last Name * Email * Phone * City * State/Province * Zip * Notes Submit Contact Info 1916 Perfect Drive, Port St. Lucie, FL 34986 [email protected] 800-800-GOLF (4653) Quick Links Join Our Team Gift Cards Donation Request Privacy Policy California Privacy Policy Terms of Service © PGA Golf Club. All rights reserved. Powered by Northstar Technologies . The PGA strives to provide a work environment that is respectful and supportive and allows a balance between professional and personal life. Join a team of proud, passionate, and caring people that together share their diverse talents and backgrounds to serve our Club Members, PGA Members, Guests and grow the game of golf. Being at PGA Golf Properties means you are supported, respected, and appreciated for your contributions. Did you know we offer: Competitive Pay 401k Plan with Employer Match Medical, Dental & Vision Plans Paid Time Off Flexible hours, days, nights, and weekends Tuition Reimbursement Continuing Education Golf privileges and the opportunity to learn the game Discounts on Golf Merchandise and in Food & Beverage Contact Info 1916 Perfect Drive, Port St. Lucie, FL 34986 [email protected] 800-800-GOLF (4653) Quick Links Join Our Team Gift Cards Donation Request Privacy Policy California Privacy Policy Terms of Service © PGA Golf Club. All rights reserved. Powered by Northstar Technologies . Sub Navigation Private Lessons Clinics Junior Programs GOLF SCHOOLS Instructor-bios Instruction Private Lessons Clinics Junior Programs GOLF SCHOOLS Instructor-bios Untitled BIO LISTING INSTRUCTOR BIOS Alex Iguchi, PGA PGA Class A Member, PGA Certified [email protected] O: 772-467-5491 Awards & Recognitions 2023 Teacher of the Year South Florida PGA SE Chapter 2024 GRAA Top 100 Growth of the Game Teaching Professional Education & Certifications PGA Class-A Member PGA Certified – General Management PGA Certified – Player Development PGA Golf Professional Diploma Van Swinderen College, Netherlands CES Army Basic Leadership Eyeline Certified Instructor Hank Haney Certified Instructor Jim McLean Certified Instructor Super Speed Golf 1, 2 & 3 TPI Level 1 Titleist Performance Institute TPI Junior 2 Titleist Performance Institute Trackman Level 1 &2 Trackman University Club Fitting Certifications Taylor Made, Callaway, Ping, Mizuno, Titleist, Cobra, Tommy Armour, Tour Edge, XXIO, Bettinardi, Edel Professional Experience Alex Iguchi is a PGA Class A Certified Golf Professional with 29 years of experience coaching and managing golf instruction programs nationally and abroad, including in Florida, Hawaii, California, Georgia, Costa Rica, Japan, Netherlands and Ukraine, where he earned the nickname “the teacher of teachers” for his work mentoring assistant professionals to become the next generation of golf instructors and club head golf professionals. An ardent student of the game, Alex uses his impressive teaching credentials in technology, biomechanics and didactics to offer the most up to date instruction in a logical, effective and easy to comprehend manner and successfully helps his students of all levels and all ages to achieve their goals by building a personal plan around their abilities, available practice time, and the philosophy of: “Train how you play; Play how you train”. Alex describes himself as a patient and supportive golf coach and looks forward to working with you. Susan Bond-Philo, PGA [email protected] C: 401-741-7545 Dedication and Achievement in Golf Susan Bond-Philo is a name well known with excellence and dedication in the world of golf. Susan has made her mark on the sport, both as a player and as an instructor for countless aspiring golfers. Her commitment to the game and her community has earned her numerous accolades and awards, including the  Player Development Award, RIPGA Teacher of the Year, the Bill Strausbaugh Award, the Professional Development Award, The Patriot Award and her induction into the 2023 New England PGA Hall of Fame. These accolades stand as a testament to her tireless efforts in promoting the game of golf and supporting her fellow professionals and community members. A Legacy of Teaching Excellence Susan's journey as a PGA Professional began in 1990 when she assumed the role of Assistant Professional at the Wellesley Country Club in Massachusetts. Over the years, she served in various capacities, including Head Golf Professional at Weekapaug Golf Club in Rhode Island, where she honed her skills and enriched her experience. Susan is  committed to education and development which  led her to take on the role of a Teaching Professional at renowned clubs such as Johns Island Club in Florida and Grand Harbor Golf Club. Her exceptional ability to create a fun and friendly  learning environment and impart expert knowledge makes her one of the most sought-after instructors in the business. We are confident that you will appreciate that Susan keeps it simple with  all her programming. A Stellar Playing Career Aside from her teaching prowess, Susan has also showcased her skills on the golf course. Her list of achievements as a player is outstanding,  winning the Connecticut Sr. Womens Open, Ohio Sr. Womens Open, the LPGA Teaching and Club Professional Sr., the South Florida Sr. Womens Championship, along with qualifying for her second USGA Sr. Womens Open in the 2024 season.  Her victories in the 2020 Tennessee Senior Women's Open and the 2017 Florida Women's Senior Open are just a glimpse of her remarkable playing career. Since graduating from the University of Alabama, where she was the captain of the team, she has won many PGA Section along with mini tour events.   Susan loves to play golf and would love to play golf with members of the PGA Golf Club. Beyond the Greens Susan's interests extend beyond the golf course. She finds joy in playing golf with her husband PGA professional Ron Philo Jr. and her role as a mom to Lindsey, Christina, and their four-legged companions - two black labs, a golden retriever, and a kitty. Her commitment to giving back to society is evident through her volunteering efforts with veterans and the disabled, helping them discover the joy of golf and its therapeutic benefits. Contact Info 1916 Perfect Drive, Port St. Lucie, FL 34986 [email protected] 800-800-GOLF (4653) Quick Links Join Our Team Gift Cards Donation Request Privacy Policy California Privacy Policy Terms of Service © PGA Golf Club. Play Hard. Whether it's a corporate outing, charity event, golf league or business meeting, there's no better place than PGA Golf Club - St. Lucie to trust with your next important event. PGA Golf Club has a number of options to suit your needs and can accommodate outings of all sizes from private board meetings to larger charity events and golf outings & tournaments.
